intro: Linanthus californicus subsp. glandulosus, commonly known as the glandular linanthus, is a flowering plant native to California. It is a member of the Loasaceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, yellow flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its glandular hairs, which give it a distinctive appearance and aid in its identification. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in coastal and inland areas. This plant plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to biodiversity.
